snippet: One group said on Thursday that it would decide within about a week whether to give up the street occupations that have lasted more than two months.
abstract: Hong Kong Federation of Students announces that it is deciding whether to abandon protest street camps that divide city's pro-democracy forces, in indication that demonstrators are no longer as determined to maintain them; student leaders have come under mounting pressure from political allies to leave camps, especially after an unsuccessful attempt to blockade government headquarters.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ALAN WONG

lead_paragraph: One group said on Thursday that it would decide within about a week whether to give up the street occupations that have lasted more than two months.

headline.main: Decision Time for Hong Kong Student Protest Leaders
headline.print_headline: Decision Time for Hong Kong Student Protest Leaders
